title: Able to compile but get "... has stopped working" error on launch in Windows 7 x64
body:
My OS is Windows 7 x64, I have installed rust and mingw as described in [this article](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/wiki/Using-Rust-on-Windows)

I'm have a simple hello world program.

```
fn main() {

    println!("Hello World!");
}
```

Compile it `rustc hello.rs`

Which gives me hello.exe. I go to run this and get:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6353339/3844091/04d5e03c-1e46-11e4-8d79-470a9c2ef976.png)

My `gdb` output is as follows

```
D:\scratchpad>gdb hello.exe

There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.  Type "show copying"
and "show warranty" for details.
This GDB was configured as "i686-w64-mingw32".
For bug reporting instructions, please see:
<http://www.gnu.org/software/gdb/bugs/>...

RM = [1]: PDM = [0].
```

Any thoughts?
